content: <?xml version="1.0"?>  <!-- ####################################################################################################################################   Jadeite file to display WSDDM/Cospa radar calibration product and algorithm inputs   A.Gaydos 12/2008 (gaydos@ucar.edu)  #################################################################################################################################### -->  <Jadeite version="1.1">  <!-- ####################################################################################################################################   XML Tips:   - XML is comprised of Elements and Attributes, as shown below:     <Element attribute="value">      <ChildElement1/>      <ChildElement2 attribute1="foo" anotherAttribute="bar"/>    </Element>   - Do NOT use ampersand, apostrophe, greater-than, less-than, dashes, or exclamation characters for your content!    These are special XML characters.  - Element names begin with a capital letter, attribute names with a lowercase.  - Elements must be terminated with a slash, either inline such as "<Element/>" or with a matching tag such as "<Element></Element>"  - Attribute values must always be double quoted  - Comments are bounded by less-than, exclamation, and 2 dashes at the beginning and 2 dashes followed by a greater-than at the end.    2 dashes (and thus comments) cannot appear anywhere within a comment (which is why I can't show them to you here).  - Blank lines, whitespace, carriage returns, and comments are completely ignored by the parser.   Jadeite Tips:   - Configuration elements contain attributes which have meaning to that element (see descriptions of each below).  - Most configuration elements can be specified on a single line, but you are free to split them on several lines for readability.  - The following elements may appear more than once in a file: "Layer," "Colorscale," and "Area." All others should only appear once!  - Some attributes may be left out or their values left empty. In those cases, the default value for that attribute applies.  #################################################################################################################################### -->  <!-- ####################################################################################################################################   <Layer> element (optional, zero or more).   Required attributes:   vis        = whether the layer should be on or off when the application starts  type       = the datatype of this layer, one of: MDV, MDVWIND, MDVTOPO, CIDDMAP, SYMPROD, WMS [WMS doesnt work yet].               This determines which other configuration options, below, are valid  name       = the name shown in the display  location   = where to get the data.   Datatype-specific options:     MDV:      field      = the short MDV field name to retrieve      is2D       = true or false (default); if 2D = true, then altitude changes do not cause a reloading of data      render     = rendering scheme which may be: grid, fillcontours, linecontours, or none (only makes for MDVWIND).      colorscale = the colorscale to use. May be the name of a colorscale defined in this file                   or a reference to a remote CIDD (*.colors) or JADE (*.xml) colorscale.      location   = must be in the form "mdvp::". Mdv files are NOT supported (yet).     MDVTOPO:      field      = the short MDV field name to retrieve      colorscale = the colorscale to use. May be the name of a colorscale defined in this file or a reference to a                   remote CIDD ("*.colors") or JADE ("*.xml") colorscale      location   = must be in the form "mdvp::".     MDVWIND:      isUandV    = true if the following fields will contain U and V vectors or false if speed and direction will be used      field      = the short MDV field name containing either the U wind vector or the wind speed in knots, depending on the value of "isUandV"      extraField = the short MDV field name containing the V wind vector or the wind direction in degrees, depending on the value of "isUandV"      is2D       = true or false (default); if 2D = true, then altitude changes do not cause a reloading of data      render     = rendering scheme ("grid" for filled grid, "fillcontours" for color-filled contours, or "linecontours" for line contours)      colorscale = the colorscale to use. May be the name of a colorscale defined in this file or a reference to a                   remote CIDD (*.colors) or JADE (*.xml) colorscale      location   = must be in the form "mdvp::".     SYMPROD:      before     = the amount of time before the currently selected time to look for products      after      = the amount of time after the currently selected time to look for products      textOff    = the spacing factor past which to stop rendering text labels      render     = the methodology to use for reconciling multiple valid products within the time period     CIDDMAP:      minKmScreenSpan        = the minimum kilometer distance across the screen at which to display this layer      maxKmScreenSpan        = the maximum kilometer distance across the screen at which to display this layer      color                  = the color with which to render the line, as an X11-defined color name, RGB triplet (each value between 0..255)                               or hex group ("wheat1", "153,153,153", "#ffffcc")      width                  = the width of the line in pixels     WMS (does not work yet!):      layers     = TODO what is this?? a comma-separated list of the id numbers for the layers to request from the server. Defaults to all.      serviceName = the name of the service to request, when, as is the case with the ESRI WMS interface, many services are served from the same URL   Notes:   - Layers are rendered in the same order in which they are defined. First layer is on bottom, last layer on top. However,     the GUI allows you to change the order by selecting "Configure -> Layer Order" from the menubar.  #################################################################################################################################### -->  <Layer vis="on" type="MDV" name="Uncorrected Precip Map-rain"      location="mdvp:://cospa21.rap.ucar.edu::CoSPA/mdv/winterwx/mosaic2D_rain_lowest"     field="precip" render="grid" colorscale="precip_rate_colorscale" />  <Layer vis="on" type="MDV" name="Uncorrected Precip Map-snow"      location="mdvp:://cospa21.rap.ucar.edu::CoSPA/mdv/winterwx/mosaic2D_snow_lowest"     field="precip" render="grid" colorscale="precip_rate_colorscale" />  <Layer vis="off" type="MDV" name="Corrected Precip Map"      location="mdvp:://cospa21.rap.ucar.edu::CoSPA/mdv/winterwx/corrected_precip_rate"     field="precip" render="grid" colorscale="precip_rate_colorscale" />  <Layer vis="off" type="MDV" name="Snow Coefficients"      location="mdvp:://cospa21.rap.ucar.edu::CoSPA/mdv/winterwx/calib_snow"     field="snow_coeff" render="grid" colorscale="coeff_colorscale" />  <Layer vis="off" type="MDV" name="Rain Coefficients"      location="mdvp:://cospa21.rap.ucar.edu::CoSPA/mdv/winterwx/calib_rain"     field="rain_coeff" render="grid" colorscale="coeff_colorscale" />  <Layer vis="off" type="MDV" name="3D mosaic"      location="mdvp:://cospa21.rap.ucar.edu::CoSPA/mdv/nsslMosaic3D/merged"     field="mrefl_mosaic" render="grid" colorscale="dbz_colorscale" />  <Layer vis="off" type="MDV" name="Precip Phase"      location="mdvp:://cospa21.rap.ucar.edu::CoSPA/mdv/mitll/SnowProb"     field="SnowProb" render="grid" colorscale="phase_colorscale" />  <Layer vis="off" type="MDV" name="Precip Phase Probablilty"      location="mdvp:://cospa21.rap.ucar.edu::CoSPA/mdv/mitll/SnowProb"     field="SnowProb" render="grid" colorscale="phase_probability_colorscale" />  <Layer vis="off" type="MDV" name="Mosaic - Bright Band Removed"         location="mdvp:://cospa21.rap.ucar.edu::CoSPA/mdv/winterwx/mosaic3D_bb"        field="mrefl_mosaic" render="grid" colorscale="dbz_colorscale" />  <Layer vis="off" type="MDV" name="Mosaic - Composite dbZ"         location="mdvp:://cospa21.rap.ucar.edu::CoSPA/mdv/winterwx/mosaicComposite"        field="mrefl_mosaic" render="grid" colorscale="dbz_colorscale" />  <Layer vis="off" type="MDV" name="Mosaic - Lowest Elev dbZ"         location="mdvp:://cospa21.rap.ucar.edu::CoSPA/mdv/winterwx/mosaicLowest"        field="Min mrefl_mosai" render="grid" colorscale="dbz_colorscale" />  <Layer vis="off" type="MDV" name="Difference Map - rain"         location="mdvp:://cospa21.rap.ucar.edu::CoSPA/mdv/winterwx/rain_diff"        field="LinearComb" render="grid" colorscale="diff_colorscale" />  <Layer vis="off" type="MDV" name="Difference Map - snow"         location="mdvp:://cospa21.rap.ucar.edu::CoSPA/mdv/winterwx/snow_diff"        field="LinearComb" render="grid" colorscale="diff_colorscale" />  <Layer vis="off" type="SYMPROD" name="ASOS"      location="spdbp:Metar2Symprod://cospa21::CoSPA/spdb/winterwx/phase_updated_stns"     before="10mins" after="" mode="LATEST_IN_FRAME" />  <Layer vis="on" type="CIDDMAP" name="US States"      location="http://rap.ucar.edu/maps/usa_states.map"     color="0,0,0" width="1" />  <Layer vis="on" type="CIDDMAP" name="LWE Sites"      location="http://rap.ucar.edu/projects/winter/COSPA/lwe_sites.map"     color="0,255,0" width="3" />  <!-- ####################################################################################################################################   Time configuration (optional, zero or one):   mode     = "realtime" or "archive" - determines data refresh and time window marching  start    = in realtime mode, start is relative to now (+ or - number of hrs or mins, or "now"), e.g., "-12hrs"             in archive mode, start must be an explicit time in the format "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm (e.g. 2008-04-30T23:41)  end      = in realtime mode, end is relative to now (+ or - number of hrs or mins, or "now"), e.g., "+15mins"             in archive mode, end must be an explicit time in the format "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm (e.g. 2008-04-30T23:41)  interval = time between selectable (and animated) ticks, beginning with the start time and ending at or before the end time  update   = time between checks for data updates (in realtime only). For performance reasons, keep this value >= 5mins.  timeZone = time zone to use for the interpretation of start/end, and to use for the display. Defaults to UTC if omitted.             Abbreviations and full descriptions are ok (eg: MST or America/Denver).  See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_zone             for a description, and http://www.timezoneconverter.com/ for a listing  #################################################################################################################################### -->  <Time mode="realtime" start="-6hrs" end="+0hrs" interval="10mins" update="5mins"/>  <!-- ####################################################################################################################################   Animation configuration (optional, zero or one):   delay = minimum milliseconds delay between animation frames  dwell = minimum milliseconds pause at the end of an animation sequence  #################################################################################################################################### -->  <Animation delay="100" dwell="500" />  <!-- ####################################################################################################################################   Altitude configuration (optional, zero or one):   units    = the units for the vertical scale (km, m, ft, FL, or mb)  bottom   = lowest altitude of range, in the same units defined above (if in mb, may be greater numerically than top)  top      = highest altitude of range, in the same units defined above (if in mb, may be lesser numerically than bottom)  interval = the interval to use for dividing up the distance between bottom and top  default  = optional initial altitude, in the same units defined above (defaults to same value as "bottom")   or   dataDrivenProperties = optional. Overrides other attributes. If true, altitude's range and levels will be                         dynamically set according to selected/on layer.  #################################################################################################################################### -->  <Altitude units="km" bottom="0" top="16" interval="0.5" default="3.5"/>  <!-- ####################################################################################################################################   View configuration (optional, zero or one):     projection = the projection in which to view the data. One of "LatLon," "Flat," "LambertConformal," or "Stereographic"   Projection-specific configuration:   LatLon:    none, defaults to -180 to +180 longitude and -90 to +90 latitude   Flat:    origLon  = longitude of the origin    origLat  = latitude of the origin    rotation = rotation of the projection   LambertConformal:    originLat = origin's latitude    originLon = origin's longitude    stdLat1 = standard latitude 1    stdLat2 = standard latitude 2 (optional)   Stereographic:    tangentLon = tangent longitude    tangentLat = tangent latitude    secantLat = secant latitude, if applicable due to secant plane  #################################################################################################################################### -->  <View projection="LambertConformal" originLon="-95.0" originLat="25.0" stdLat1="25.0" />  <!-- ####################################################################################################################################   Areas of Interest (optional, zero or more):     name = the name of the Area shown in the display  minLon = the minimum longitude of the lat/lon bounding box defining the Area in decimal degrees or degrees, minutes, seconds  minLat = the minimum latitude of the lat/lon bounding box defining the Area in decimal degrees or degrees, minutes, seconds  maxLon = the maximum longitude of the lat/lon bounding box defining the Area in decimal degrees or degrees, minutes, seconds  maxLat = the maximum latitude of the lat/lon bounding box defining the Area in decimal degrees or degrees, minutes, seconds  defaultView = (optional) true or false; if true, then the Area will be the default view for the main window   Note:    - If more than one Area has a defaultView of true, then the last one listed will be the default view      name  defaultView   minLon   minLat maxLon  maxLat  #################################################################################################################################### -->  <Area name="COSPA Domain" minLon="-95" minLat="32" maxLon="-65" maxLat="49.5" defaultView="true" />  <!-- ####################################################################################################################################   Window parameters (optional element, zero or one):   width = pixel width of the window, if the screen is big enough  height = pixel height of the window, if the screen is big enough  xOrigin = (optional) pixel x location of the upper left of the window, measured from upper left of the screen  yOrigin = (optional) pixel y location of the upper left of the window, measured from upper left of the screen (positive downwards)  #################################################################################################################################### --> <Window width="1000" height="900" xOrigin="0" yOrigin="0"/>  <!-- ####################################################################################################################################   This section MUST appear *below* the Layer definitions!   XSections:   XSections = optional element. Zero or one allowed. If this element is missing, then cross-sections will be disabled.  Path = optional element representing a preconfigured xsect path. Zero or more allowed.    name = name attribute for the xsection Path element    Waypoint = 2 or more elements required for each Path. Ordered waypoints for the path. Requires lat and lon attributes.  #################################################################################################################################### -->  <!-- ####################################################################################################################################   SkewT parameters:   SkewT            = optional element. Zero or one allowed. If this element is missing, then SkewTs will be disabled.  location         = Required. where to get the data eg: mdvp:://yaw:10000:ruc/mdv/lambert  temperatureField = Required. Name of the MDV 3-D temperature field.  rhField          = either rhField or dewpointField required.  Name of the MDV 3-D relative humidity field. Server side units                     must be correct (ie: % means 0..100, whereas unitless means 0..1)  dewpointField    = either rhField or dewpointField required. Name of the MDV 3-D dewpoint field.  uField           = Required. Name of the MDV 3-D u-wind field. Speed/dir not supported (yet)  vField           = Required. Name of the MDV 3-D v-wind field. Speed/dir not supported (yet)  #################################################################################################################################### -->  <!-- ####################################################################################################################################   ColorScale configuration (zero or more):   id    = the name of the colorscale, used to refer to it from "Layer" defintions  Range = one or more Range elements required  min   = the minimum value of the bin; attribute of the Range element, required  max   = the maximum value of the bin; attribute of the Range element, required  color = an X11-defined color name, RGB triplet (0..255 for each value), or hex group ("wheat1", "153,153,153", "#ffffcc");          attribute of the Range element, required  label = the optional custom label to apply to this bin. Defaults to the numeric values of the bin boundaries.          ; attribute of the Range element, optional   Note:     - when a value can be in more than one bin (overlapping) the last matching (descending) bin color is used  #################################################################################################################################### -->  <ColorScale id="dbz_colorscale">   <Range min="-40" max="-10" color="38,115,35"/>   <Range min="-10" max="-6" color="99,97,58"/>   <Range min="-6" max="-3" color="22,133,15"/>   <Range min="-3" max="0" color="0,203,108"/>   <Range min="0" max="3" color="60,179,113"/>   <Range min="3" max="6" color="97,209,159"/>   <Range min="6" max="9" color="124,104,238"/>   <Range min="9" max="12" color="0,4,247"/>   <Range min="12" max="15" color="3,0,141"/>   <Range min="15" max="18" color="100,34,134"/>   <Range min="18" max="21" color="148,70,96"/>   <Range min="21" max="24" color="178,51,102"/>   <Range min="24" max="27" color="140,37,90"/>   <Range min="27" max="31" color="156,78,42"/>   <Range min="31" max="35" color="212,104,31"/>   <Range min="35" max="40" color="215,171,36"/>   <Range min="40" max="45" color="255,253,8"/>   <Range min="45" max="50" color="231,134,101"/>   <Range min="50" max="55" color="250,120,118"/>   <Range min="55" max="60" color="238,46,43"/>   <Range min="60" max="65" color="255,25,159"/>   <Range min="65" max="70" color="210,212,209"/>   <Range min="70" max="80" color="255,255,255"/> </ColorScale>  <ColorScale id="precip_rate_colorscale">   <Range min="0" max="0.1" color="0,100,0"/>   <Range min="0.1" max="0.2" color="32,142,43"/>   <Range min="0.2" max="0.4" color="153,206,54"/>   <Range min="0.4" max="0.6" color="0,0,125"/>   <Range min="0.6" max="0.8" color="0,0,209"/>   <Range min="0.8" max="1" color="0,0,255"/>   <Range min="1" max="1.2" color="74,60,135"/>   <Range min="1.2" max="1.5" color="137,207,243"/>   <Range min="1.5" max="2" color="203,22,125"/>   <Range min="2" max="2.5" color="255,127,80"/>   <Range min="2.5" max="3" color="255,160,0"/>   <Range min="3" max="5" color="255,215,0"/>   <Range min="5" max="7" color="253,255,0"/>   <Range min="7" max="10" color="255,69,0"/>   <Range min="10" max="20" color="250,2,0"/>   <Range min="20" max="80" color="0,0,0"/> </ColorScale>  <ColorScale id="coeff_colorscale">   <Range min="10" max="50" color="136,0,0"/>   <Range min="50" max="100" color="251,2,0"/>   <Range min="100" max="125" color="255,169,0"/>   <Range min="125" max="150" color="254,164,6"/>   <Range min="150" max="175" color="255,127,80"/>   <Range min="175" max="200" color="254,215,0"/>   <Range min="200" max="225" color="255,255,4"/>   <Range min="225" max="250" color="255,255,255"/>   <Range min="250" max="275" color="152,205,52"/>   <Range min="275" max="300" color="34,139,34"/>   <Range min="300" max="325" color="0,100,0"/>   <Range min="325" max="350" color="133,207,234"/>   <Range min="350" max="375" color="0,0,255"/>   <Range min="375" max="400" color="0,0,200"/>   <Range min="400" max="500" color="1,1,125"/>   <Range min="500" max="1000" color="160,32,239"/>   <Range min="1000" max="1500" color="72,62,133"/>   <Range min="1500" max="2000" color="0,0,0"/> </ColorScale>  <ColorScale id="phase_colorscale">   <Range min="0" max="39" color="0,255,0" label="Rain"/>   <Range min="40" max="59" color="255,0,0" label="Mixed"/>   <Range min="60" max="100" color="0,0,255" label="Snow"/> </ColorScale>  <ColorScale id="phase_probability_colorscale">   <Range min="0" max="10" color="136,0,0"/>   <Range min="10" max="20" color="251,2,0"/>   <Range min="20" max="30" color="255,169,0"/>   <Range min="30" max="40" color="254,164,6"/>   <Range min="40" max="50" color="255,127,80"/>   <Range min="50" max="60" color="254,215,0"/>   <Range min="60" max="70" color="255,255,4"/>   <Range min="70" max="80" color="255,255,255"/>   <Range min="80" max="90" color="152,205,52"/>   <Range min="90" max="100" color="34,139,34"/> </ColorScale>  <ColorScale id="diff_colorscale">   <Range min="-80" max="-20" color="0,100,0"/>   <Range min="-20" max="-10" color="32,142,43"/>   <Range min="-10" max="-5" color="153,206,54"/>   <Range min="-5" max="-3" color="0,0,125"/>   <Range min="-3" max="-1" color="0,0,209"/>   <Range min="-1" max="-0.6" color="0,0,255"/>   <Range min="-0.6" max="-0.3" color="74,60,135"/>   <Range min="-0.3" max="-0.001" color="137,207,243"/>   <Range min="0.001" max="0.3" color="203,22,125"/>   <Range min="0.3" max="0.6" color="255,127,80"/>   <Range min="0.6" max="1" color="255,160,0"/>   <Range min="1" max="3" color="255,215,0"/>   <Range min="3" max="5" color="253,255,0"/>   <Range min="5" max="10" color="255,69,0"/>   <Range min="10" max="20" color="250,2,0"/>   <Range min="20" max="80" color="255,255,255"/> </ColorScale> <!-- ####################################################################################################################################   Other configuration parameters:  #################################################################################################################################### -->  </Jadeite>
